intro: Moraea ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun. It has strap-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular blooms during the summer months. Moraea ochroleuca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
